dbxrefs.description: Identifiers from external resources that may have 1-to-1 or 1-to-many relationships with ENCODE objects.
dbxrefs.title: External resources

items.description: Identifier from an external resource that may have 1-to-1 or 1-to-many relationships with ENCODE objects.
items.title: External identifier

schema_version.hidden comment: Bump the default in the subclasses.

alternate_accessions.description: Accessions previously assigned to objects that have been merged with this object.
alternate_accessions.comment: Do not submit. Only admins are allowed to set or update this value.
alternate_accessions.title: Alternate accessions

items.description: An accession previously assigned to an object that has been merged with this object.
items.comment: Only accessions of objects that have status equal replaced will work here.
items.title: Alternate Accession

elasticsearch_mapping_index_type.description: Defines one of three types of indexing available
elasticsearch_mapping_index_type.title: Field mapping index type

description.description: A plain text description of the dataset.
description.title: Description

internal_tags.description: Some datasets are part of particular data collections
internal_tags.title: Internal tags

date_released.comment: Do not submit, value is assigned whe the object is releaesd.
date_released.title: Date released

description: Schema for submitting metadata for an assay with 1 or more replicates.
title: Experiment
comment: An experiment is a special case of dataset. It includes assay metadata, replicate information and data files.

___supersedes.description: The experiment(s) that this experiment supersedes by virtue of being newer, better etc. than the one(s) it supersedes.
___supersedes.title: Supersedes

items.comment: See experiment.json for a list of available identifiers.

___documents.description: Protocols or other documents that describe the assay or the results (not data files).

___target.description: For assays, such as ChIP-seq or RIP-seq, the name of the gene whose expression or product is under investigation for the experiment.
___target.title: Target

___pipeline_error_detail.description: Explanation of why the experiment failed pipeline analysis.
___pipeline_error_detail.comment: should be used on experiments with internal_status:pipeline error
___pipeline_error_detail.title: Pipeline error message

___control_type.description: The specific type of control if the experiment is a control.
___control_type.title: Control type

___related_files.description: To be removed in a future release after data cleanup.
___related_files.title: Additional data files

___possible_controls.description: Dataset that contain files that can serve as scientific controls for this experiment.
___possible_controls.title: Controls

items.description: A dataset that contains files that can serve as a scientific control for this experiment.
items.comment: See dataset.json for a list of available identifiers. Exact pairing of data files with their controls is done using file relationships.
items.title: Control

___internal_status.description: The status of an experiment in the DCC process.
___internal_status.comment: unreviewed:wrangler has not evaluated, unrunnable:experiment requires more metadata to run, pipeline ready:experiment is ready for the pipeline, processing:pipeline is running, pipeline completed: pipeline has run through completion, requires lab review:there are QC concerns about this data, release ready:DCC feels that this is ready for release, pipeline error:pipeline run was started but failed for a reason that should be noted in pipeline_error_message
___internal_status.title: Internal status

___date_submitted.description: The date that the experiment received all required replicates and files
___date_submitted.comment: Do not submit. date_submitted will be assigned only by DCC personnel.
___date_submitted.title: Date submitted

___dbxrefs.description: Identifiers from external resources that may have 1-to-1 or 1-to-many relationships with ENCODE objects.
___dbxrefs.title: External resources

items.description: An identifier from an external resource that may have 1-to-1 or 1-to-many relationships with ENCODE objects.
items.title: External identifier

items.description: One group of files which form a coherent analysis.
items.title: Analysis

___files.description: A list of processed files belonging to this analsis
___files.title: Analysis files
